website_summaries.verdict: The Dymo LetraTag 100H Plus handheld label printer is an inexpensive choice for printing paper, plastic, iron-on, and metallic labels.
pros: Good for handheld or desktop use
Choice of paper, plastic, iron-on fabric, or metallic labels
cons: Uses a shift function with embedded numeric keys instead of dedicated number keys

customer_reviews.title: Labels don’t stick to plastic
customer_reviews.text: Pretty underwhelmed. The labels only stuck to things that were paper or cardboard, it didn’t stick to anything plastic I put it on. It really didn’t even pretend to try, the edges lifted moments after I stuck the label on. I have a brother p-touch at work and it’s awesome. I got this cause it was more compact and had decent reviews. I’d also prefer the letters to be like a keyboard unlike this which are just listed alphabetically. I got this just after Xmas but didn’t have time to use it till just now. Unfortunately my return window just closed otherwise I would have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: 4everhawkeye

customer_reviews.title: Love the label maker but the labels aren't sticking -- ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the label maker but the labels aren't sticking -- I bought it to label holiday decorations plastic storage crates with contents and labels won't stick. I've put books on top of them, etc. Ended up putting scotch tape over the labels. Also tried it on glass mason jars again labels won't stick. I don't know if I got a bad cartridge and need to try a refill but totally defeats the purpose if I can't get the labels to stick!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Labels do not stick.
customer_reviews.text: The label maker itself works great, but the tape it comes with is worthless. The labels I made started peeling off the same day. I had to go back and put tape over the top of the labels.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Leaverton

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Sticks to plastic
customer_reviews.text: Once I figured out how to use this label maker I loved it. As you can see I made a spice organizer. I painted the inside of a cabinet with magnetic paint, brought these little, magnet backed tins from the Dollar Store , and then filled them with spices and herbs and made all the labels. Someone said the labels would not stick to plastic but all the windows in the tins are plastic. I also labeled glass, ceramics, and metal. There is a big space before and after each word which would waste tape so I printed a dozen labels at a time with 3 spaces between each individual label. Also, to remove the backing fold the label horizontally.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: It worked great the first few times and now it keeps saying ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to try to return which an big inconvince for me and who know if I will have the time these days. It worked great the first few times and now it keeps saying tape jam, so I looked online to see if maybe I could find an easy fix and I found many, however nothing has worked so far. I even put new tape in and guess what nothing. I was in the middle of a project so I was super excited to have this machine but now I am not. It really is a hit or miss if you decide to buy this product. Good Luck and I hope you get a better on than I did.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Green

customer_reviews.title: Edit: DYMO Replaced Defective Device- No Hassle
customer_reviews.text: My first DYMO 100H Plus label maker died just after Amazon's return window expired. I sent a short e-mail to DYMO describing the problem and after some troubleshooting, sent a replacement. Great customer service! That shouldn't have been a surprise, but I think customer service has mostly been ignored for quite a while, so it surprised me. Especially because it concerned a $20 item! Every one of their replies was pleasant and respectful. Bottom line for me is, I won't hesitate buying or recommending DYMO products. Their customer service is fantastic, and a special shout out to Khahn is deserved (Though probably won't be seen): thank you again!
customer_reviews.author: Bud Boggy

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this item for my office. It worked for a total of less than 3 weeks before saying there was a tape jam. Opened and found no tape jam. Replaced the tape with a fresh cartridge. It still said there was a tape jam. Took out the brand new battery and replaced it with another brand new battery. Still would not work. Very disappointing. We are hoping that this is a fluke and that a replacement will resolve the issue. If not, I would never recommend this item to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gail H Clark

customer_reviews.title: 2 stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm changing my review for this because it already quit working. I just bought it in March. It should have lasted longer than 3 months. And the fact that it cannot be returned anymore is not right. I am very unhappy with this rule ... there should be more than a 30 day return time on any electronic.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Nelson

customer_reviews.title: I just returned this item. I opened it up ...
customer_reviews.text: I just returned this item. I opened it up, put batteries in and it kept saying low battery and wasn't printing clearly. So I went about bought brand new batteries, put them in and it wouldn't even turn on again. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Severson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this label maker for a few years, used it a handful of times. Put fresh batteries in this morning and bam, ‘tape jam’. What that really means is that the motor isn’t moving. There’s no actual tape jammed up. If you need a reliable unit, go with something else, possibly a higher-end one. We’ve had label makers at work which have been working for 10+ years of constant use, so I’m really disappointed that this one didn’t even survive a dozen uses. Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Carsten Langrock

customer_reviews.title: Straight out of the box, doesn't work - JUNK!!!
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box, this doesn't work. The labels aren't printing because the rolling mechanism can't feed the label out. It's stuck in one place. Troubleshooting guides say to clean the inside of the machine with alcohol and a "provided brush". Well my unit did not include a brush. Attempted to clean it using a cotton swab, but no luck. This is just a hunk of junk. Going to return it right away. Also keep note that this thing doesn't even have a qwerty keyboard. Was so looking forward to organizing files today. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: NoOne

customer_reviews.title: Ink fades fast. Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Got it in the mail and i was super excited about labeling all the 100 plus drawers in my work shop. Have 10 employees and things get confusing especially with the new employees. Worked fantastic and was really happy with unit until about 6 months down the road the ink slowly faded and and after 8 months labels are all illegible. Call me old fashioned but im getting tired of throwing things into the trash can due to the poor quality of products offered up to us in today's market.
customer_reviews.author: Sary B.

customer_reviews.title: Super nice, but labels aren't very sticky.
customer_reviews.text: This is so handy, I use it to label everything in my life now and its such a snap. All of my: Phone / everything cords Kids backpacks Anything that goes to school Shelves in our home school room Ear buds case Purse w phone number in case I lose it And many other things Are labeled! Only negative the stickers dont stay on very well I'm afraid. I find myself using my fingernail to press back down the ends on some things like plastic water bottles, plastic school communication binders etc. Yeah, can be a deal breaker- time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Non existant service!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item because i liked the features and felt a well known Company would have good service. I received the item and used it a total of three labels when it stopped working. I called the company (at least 5 times) and was told that everyone was in a staff meeting. Then one day after holding for 45 minutes I got a person! That person was helpful, I thought. She said she would send a new item and sent me a return packing slip for the defective one. I sent mine back and I'm still WAITING for the substitution one. 6 weeks should be enough for a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken tape dispenser
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and used it a few times and then it said tape jam. I even put on a new tape and it the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: nlh

customer_reviews.title: This is the tape jam you have been looking for
customer_reviews.text: Looking for more tape jam in your life? Look no further than the dymo letratag LT-100H! Guaranteed to tape jam again and again, you’ll never have to worry about successfully printing another label again! Features soft buttons to mash down in frustration as tape jam appears print attempt after print attempt, and a easy to read large lcd display so you can clearly see TAPE JAM. Disclaimer: no labels were printed during the writing of this review.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value!
customer_reviews.text: This label maker was exactly what I was looking for... easy to use, and low priced. Let's face it, a label maker is not something you use around the house every day, so I didn't care to spend a lot for something that would sit around in a cabinet most of the time. This LT-100H fits the bill perfectly! Very easy to use, very reasonably priced, and prints beautiful labels. I used it to label some DVD's I had recorded and it was perfect! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Pete Parry

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP Label Machine! Had to revise my feedback for this awful product
customer_reviews.text: REVIEW (Before): Great price, great shipping, item perfect condition. Thank you! Have tested printing with it already and everything is golden REVIEW (Now): This label machine randomly broke on me after only using it for like 10-20 prints maybe. When I say broke, something happened to the way it's printing. It doesn't write full (There are missing ink points). I noticed this when creating a line separator to have 2 lines to text printed. I am not sure what is going on but this is something I should have tested immediately when receiving it so I could have returned/exchanged it. I recommend paying an extra few dollars and getting a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Persian Chris

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work - DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Finally had a chance to open the box and get it out, and it doesn't work. Tried looking up troubleshooting, but the fact that it won't actually pull the ribbon through, just prints and doesn't move, the only 'fix' was to manually force it with a paperclip. It's brand new, I shouldn't have to rig it. With everything going on in the world, I hadn't taken it out of the box yet, and am past my 30 days so I'm stuck with a $30 paperweight. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: I love this :)
customer_reviews.text: First things first. I’m very happy with this label maker. In my opinion, it works like a charm. It was easy to learn. The labels themselves print nicely and everything works as advertised. I find the size to be very convenient as well. I’ve had no issues with the labels sticking to plastics or smooth surfaces. However, I did try to put a label on a wooden surface and that didn’t work out for me. I’m happy with my choice to purchase this label maker and would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Julianna Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Wast of money! Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: I just received my DYMO label maker, and it doesn't even work. I keep getting a "label jam" error message. I tried multiple ways to fix it after reading some of the Q&A section. I put on brand new quality batteries, tried all three cassettes it came with, and reset it to factory settings. None of it worked, and there is no label jammed. I even post a new question, and another customer replied he had the same issues, and he had no success in fixing it. WASTE OF MONEY AND TIME. Stay away from it!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving 2 stars for the prompt service I received from the company after the first labeler I received did not print so they replaced it. But now I'm done with this ha. The second label maker made exactly 5 labels and once again it quit printing. I had bought this label maker because I owned one just like it , which I loved, for five years. My daughter took it to college so I bought this one! Definitely not the same quality as my previous one. I was in the middle of a project so I ran out and bought a different brand of label maker and so far very glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: heidi christopher

customer_reviews.title: Nerdy fun! (with one caveat)
customer_reviews.text: DO RECOMMEND! Really nice product, esp for the low price. Easy to load cartridge tapes. Provides lots of added fancy (non-ASCII) characters and several print sizes. DO NOT RECOMMEND using the paper tape. 3/3 paper cartridges started to skip printing about 2/3 way through. One jammed and broke an internal part - this is my second purchase of the printer. The plastic tape works great! I do wish the keys were laid out in QWERY order instead of alphabet. But that’s a personal preference, not a fault. BTW be sure to get the optional case - it fits perfectly and makes the printer it easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: gary_in_sf

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Batteries not included. You will need 4 pcs of AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: MSD16

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money, but...
customer_reviews.text: Great product and good value for money. One of my reasons for not giving 5 stars is the lack of font diversity. Only 3 types exist - regular, bold and italics. Also, the use of the italics does not always print well - it appears as if a design flaw may exist. For example, when I typed the word "property" in italics, it seems as if two letters in the word were omitted (the word appeared as if its letters collapsed on itself - NOT legible. The regular font prints ok.
customer_reviews.author: O. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: The label maker is nice but don't trust the magnets on the holder
customer_reviews.text: Label maker works well but when I put it in the included magnetic holder and stuck it on a metal surface the magnets disconnected from the plastic holder causing the machine to fall onto the floor in the middle of the night, making a lot of noise and causing me to bust into the living room with my AR-15 and plate carrier thinking we were being robbed. We weren't, it was just this heavy, high quality label maker hitting the floor.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Not the best, but if you don’t have fast printing needs - sure
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to order this label maker and happy it wasn’t expensive. It reinforced the mantra “You get what you pay for” x 50. Pro’s: Inexpensive, works as advertised, isn’t loud. Con’s: Slooooooow. Button response time is slow too. Print function takes abut 10-12 seconds of printing time. If I could redo my order, I’d have bought a version that had 4+ stars and wasn’t more than $10 more than this item.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Love how the labels turned out for my toiletries using the clear plastic tape. My only complaints are that the “hood” where the tape goes in doesn’t snap shut, it kinda just sits there. My main issue with this is that the letters are not in the order of a normal keyboard, so it takes a while to find the letters you’re looking for. I also don’t like that it is battery operated instead of corded. I put batteries in and got a “low battery” notice within several minutes of use. But this could be an issue with the batteries and not the machine. I will probably return and buy the version with the QWERTY keyboard
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Not 3 cartridges, only 2...and they don’t stick
customer_reviews.text: First off all, the advertisement for this labeled is misleading, as it does not come with three cartridges, only two. Secondly, I think the tape cartridges must be old, because they do not stick to the plastic nail swatches that I am making. I spent a long time tediously typing out each name of my Nail Dip colors and applying the tape to each nail swatch, only to have the name stickers roll up. Ugh. So frustrating!!! I’m going to a brick and mortar store and invest in something more expensive because I definitely don’t want this to happen again. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mz. Kindra

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a small job and ended up labeling half my garage. I love it. It's easy to use, cheap and prints perfectly. If I had any complaint at all it would be that some of the tags began to peel a bit. However, this is only 5-10% of them and I was using it on old stained wood cabinet drawers in a hot hot garage. When I put these on something less porous and smoother I have no complaints. In any case a dot of super glue fixes any of my work that eventually peels. I think I was pushing the ability of the adhesive pretty hard. Excellent product. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Blithe

customer_reviews.title: Nice size/Excellent label quality
customer_reviews.text: I like this label maker in the fact that it is compact and the labels it produces are great quality. The "keyboard" is not arranged like a computer so finding the correct keys was different at first, but I caught on quickly. I have used a Brother label maker which is twice the size with a keyboard akin to a computer, and it worked great too. However, I wanted one that was smaller and more portable. Easy to change the tape inside as well. Comes with a nice base holder for placing it on a wall-surface for quick access. Could not be happier with this product.
customer_reviews.author: IceyS

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty low-grade for a product in 2020. It has nice heft and is easy to hold and operate, but... The text is grainy and blocky and reminiscent of an old dot-matrix printer. The tape cutter is not sharp and makes the edges look torn. Everything will be printed in bold, because the "normal" font setting is heavy and black. And even with brand new batteries, the buttons occasionally need to be pushed twice before they respond. I have a 10-year-old label maker from Brother that makes this one look like 1994. Three stars because it functions and seems like it's sturdy, but I plan to return it.
customer_reviews.author: K.H.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in March just started using it. Making labels for high school marching Band uniform room! Went through my first paper cartridge, ordered more! It came today and now it says paper jam! I googled and YouTubed! Tried everything possible! Still says paper jam and does not work! So now I’m stuck with a broken machine that I passed the return window and three paper cartridges! Not happy at all! And I was in a roll!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra ingram

customer_reviews.title: Stay Calm
customer_reviews.text: Good machine. Easier to use than the old twist & squeeze Dymo we all remember. I have 11 wigs, (soon to be 12). I still keep them in the bags they came in. All but the blonde one are black. I can't tell them apart, till I've pulled them all out! They are hard to put back! By then I'm soooo... pissed!!!! So, today I labeled all the bags. Now I should have a little less aggravation, in my life.
customer_reviews.author: Moochas Smootchas

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than half a roll of tape.  Says "tape jamb" but there isn't
customer_reviews.text: Yes it's fully seated(the tape cartridge) and even with tape removed same message. Fresh batteries, etc. It's unusable and I still have 2 whole rolls plus not much gone from this roll. Can't believe it didn't last AT ALL! Also missing the Z key, didn't realize how much I used the Z.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S

customer_reviews.title: Prints well, but slow.
customer_reviews.text: The paper labels print slowly, which is expected for the price. The label maker has a wide selection of characters, more than any reasonable person would need. The special characters are not easy to navigate on this one, but typical for label makers. Labels adhere to most home surfaces with no difficulty. Labels printing fades extremely quickly in wet environments, adhesion is still good (what's the use with faded writing). For the typical home/office use label maker, this works fine. good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves this
customer_reviews.text: We just recently moved to a new house and so my wife went crazy over labeling all these new arts and crafts shelves to stay more organized. The hype has died down in here but she still randomly using the label maker. She hasn't complained about it being hard to use or anything and the labels look good.
customer_reviews.author: J & R

customer_reviews.title: Stopped printing correctly after first use.
customer_reviews.text: It worked the first time I used it, and then I got it out to work the second time, right after the 30 day return period of course and it doesn’t work this morning only Eight hours after I can‘t return it. Here’s a picture of what it prints like now, this is only the second time I’ve used it. I tried another cartridge and still the same thing. :( not happy at all, and I usually like dymo printers! I’ve used many of them at school!
customer_reviews.author: A. Marcroft

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but magnetic holder not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: I took off 1 star overall because you can’t adjust the margins of the labels. It wastes a lot of label tape. Another reason is after you put batteries in it, the magnetics on the holder are not strong enough to support it & one of the magnets already fell off. I can glue it back though. The whole reason I bought this particular one was for the magnetic holder & I really disappointed it doesn’t hold up. Otherwise the machine itself is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Tosha S.

customer_reviews.title: Self-destructs after the slightest use.
customer_reviews.text: After about 8 months of very intermittent use and being stored in a drawer, the LCD display crapped out. It still prints labels, you just can't see what you're writing or change settings. And, of course, it's now too late to return. I didn't even make it through the roll of label tape that came with it. Well, I guess that's the sort of quality one gets for $18. Lesson learned. Don't waste your money on this instant garbage.
customer_reviews.author: phageghost

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great label maker. It's inexpensive and not that big so it doesn't take up a lot of space. Battery life is good thanks to the auto off feature. I haven't changed the batteries since I got this a few months ago and I use this about 5 hours a week. It's easy to use and the keys are big enough which helps minimize typos. There's many different options for fonts, symbols, sizes, lines, etc. The replacement labels are inexpensive and they come in different colors. I highly recommend this label maker.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: Unit came with a roll of paper
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to replace another Dymo label maker. This one has expanded capabilities in term of what it can print like symbols. The roll that came with the label maker is made of paper not plastic or film. I taped a sample on a flat surface of a firewall but it peeled by itself within a few minutes. Printing is fast enough.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mai

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: By far the best 17 dollars I have spent in a long time. I saw some of the negative reviews and still ordered it. I have had no problems with it, works like a charm. Easy to load, easy to learn, and very much worth my money. I dont' understand some of the complaints I have used it a lot and not one issue
customer_reviews.author: RMSix(6)

customer_reviews.title: Great for Organizing; but Weird Font
customer_reviews.text: Does an absolutely great job at labeling! Most of the time, the labels adhere to everything, there are some types of plastic surfaces that it doesn't like to adhere to. I wish the lower case g, j, p,q, and y would allow the tail to drop below the other letters instead of scrunching it up with the general script line. It looks weird. So I generally type everything in upper case to alleviate that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Koopa Mcthunder

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I have a Brother label maker and love it, but the tapes are expensive. When I saw this Dymo LetraTag at a good price and tapes that are relatively inexpensive, I decided to buy this for a condo we own. It is easy to use and the labels look good. but I thought I'd be getting 2 extra tapes. In reality, it's 2 tapes total. The choices were the unit that included one tape or an alternative that I misinterpreted as 2 extra tapes. Just so you know...don't bother with the "plus". Get the basic one and buy extra tapes is my suggestion. Not nearly as good as the Brother, but it's half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Deedee

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier model of this and loved it. Once the LCD screen started to die, I bought one of the LT100T labelers, but I honestly prefer the smaller LT100H. When it came time to buy one for the office, I went back to my favorite. I've also noted that the LetraTag label makers waste much less label tape before and after the printing than the brother label maker that my friend has.
customer_reviews.author: KRaesMom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and to keep you organized
customer_reviews.text: For a long time I wanted a label maker. I told myself that I would be more organized if I had one. Let me tell you, I am. As soon as I got this, I wanted to label everything and organize my house. Now with the quarantine was a great time to do it. It is so easy to use and there are so many options to print.
customer_reviews.author: Tamires & John

customer_reviews.title: My favorite organizing tool
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! I first experienced it at a job many years ago. When I became an office manager, I bought one brand new for my new office for my company. Even though that was a long time ago, I decided to buy another one recently because I believed it would help me with organization at home. I have not been disappointed; It feels great knowing that I finally have on of these and can get as organized as I want!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha Wilks

customer_reviews.title: Most important to know how to expose the sticky side.
customer_reviews.text: This DYMO works very well. I am well pleased with it. Just a bit of practice working through the directions and I was ready to go. OK, small problem figuring out how to get the backing off the printed tape as there were NO instructions saying to fold lengthwise and peel off half a side of plastic at a time, but I eventually mastered it. And I can mount it on the wall for easy access. Really a very good buy. FredPM
customer_reviews.author: FredPM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing toy for 5 year old
customer_reviews.text: My kid is learning to spell and I find this toy the most appropriate for his age. He is happy walking around the house labeling light switches, personal items, toys. I borrowed it couple times to label by hard drives and kids water bottles. Hours of fun, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: New York Shopper

customer_reviews.title: This is a good label maker
customer_reviews.text: This is a good and easy product to use However, for my needs I have to cut both sides of the printed label (the blank parts), which to me is a waste of label (& money).. The label maker needs a specific amount of blank label on each end...like a margins. I have not been able to make modification to change the gaps/margin. It looks fine with the extra tap.but where i am adhearing it too has a very small place for the lable.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Oliveira

customer_reviews.title: Label Everything!
customer_reviews.text: I am very OCD when it comes to my area in the house. I have never labeled before I got this. The extra rolls really helped. It was worth getting the 3 rolls. I already ran out of one of them. It is very easy to learn and you can even have little hearts and cute little symbols on them. I am very happy that I got this one compared to any of the other ones as it has an amazing print quality, symbols, easy to learn and use. This was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ash Wag

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality and plenty of design options.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this label machine. It is easy to use. Has lots of fun designs and symbols. Prints nice and evenly. Tip: to remove the backing, the tape is split down the middle, long ways, so peel from the center. Hope that makes sense. The paper is a quite thin. I hope these last when applied.
customer_reviews.author: W. Rome

customer_reviews.title: I really like it! It is quite different from the Dymo ...
customer_reviews.text: It took an hour to try to figure out how to find / or -, but once I got used to it, I really like it! It is quite different from the Dymo LetraTag that I used to own; e.g. No CAPS button to toggle. Overall, once I mastered how to find /,-,and capital or lowercase I found it quite easy!
customer_reviews.author: June Houck

customer_reviews.title: It needs to be reset all the time..and sometimes that doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like every time I go to use the labeler, it has a jumbled up screen with upper and lower case "P"s, and is non responsive to the pressing ANY keys. New batteries or old, it doesn't matter. I have to reset it, by turning it off, removing the cassette, then holding down the O/J keys, num lock and turning it back on. Sometimes that works, sometimes it doesn't, and I just don't use it for a while. A labeler shouldn't require this much work. It's a labeler, not an old Jeep.
customer_reviews.author: Joe buys stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great little handheld label maker!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a quick and easy way to organize items and this is the perfect solution. The machine has a great variety of sizes, fonts, and symbols to help you write anything you might need. It is easy to use and the included tapes are great. it came with a magnetic holder that I'm guessing is meant for a fridge. The magnet wasn't strong enough to hold the machine (it's decently heavy for its size!) but that's ok with me. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I use these to label inventory for my business and this works fantastically. It has a convenient memory feature so you can save labels that you know you will use often. Very easy to use and I didn't need to read any of the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: S. Vukov

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, but I wish I had splurged a little and gotten one with a QWERTY keyboard. Also, there is about a 1/2" lead on the tape when it prints. However, it is a very good labeler and is working well for labeling items in my pantry and craft room.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia G.M.

customer_reviews.title: I love the magnetic holder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my art studio, I have a metal door so I was so happy to see this with a magnetic holder (bonus!!!) the lab lee works fine, just as expected and I’m totally happy with it! Would definitely recommend it, or purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Janice Tancredi

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little gadget. I’m sure if you’re a parent you understand the need to label EVERYTHING, so no one can try to claim your kids stuff or if you’re kid loses something it can be returned. We pay good money for these school products man. This labeler helps protect the investment with out you having to write their name a thousand times lol.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Barry

customer_reviews.title: Best Label Maker I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice label maker. I checked the reviews for several selling on Amazon, and this one overall got the best reviews that I saw. It is so easy to use, and I’m not one for reading instructions. I’ve been using it for several months now, and love it. It's easy use, easy to type, easy to print, print is bold, and easy to remove the sticker. I’m glad I made this purchase, and I have recommended this DYMO Letra Tag LT-100H to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: ATANA

customer_reviews.title: Good for price but I would recommend the QWERTY version
customer_reviews.text: Good little label maker for the price. Not as transparent on ease of use, so save the instructions, and it cuts off quickly to save battery so you have to constantly push the ON button to wake it back up too often. I prefer the plastic labels and this cones with paper labels. But the plastic ones - generic are available. If I had to do it over again. I would have gotten the QWERTY version
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: if you have OCD, look no further!
customer_reviews.text: I have OCD and my entire family has ADD. This has saved my sanity. I literally labeled my entire pantry... like, who the hell can't put cereal where it goes? Now, nobody can't say they don't know where it goes. Same for all the cupboards. Cereal bowls...coffee cups... yep! Mama isn't the only one who has to unload the dishwasher! I ordered two packs of refill tapes today!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable label maker!
customer_reviews.text: I've got several of these units now, but one thing is sure...they are solid, dependable, and affordable to use! They also (unlike many other similar products) have kept their consumables (batteries, tape rolls) available on the market for a long time...so you aren't buying a tool that you can't get tapes for a year later! (one of my dymo's is over 10 years old, and still works like new!) That is real PEACE OF MIND! HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie C

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy labeler you can't live without!
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these for 15 years and dropped it and broke it. I love this labeler. It's easy to use and the refill are priced cheap enough. It has always been a workhorse. And trust me I love to label everything! I highly recommend this product. The price was very reasonable...less than the first time I bought it years ago. It shipped to my door in 2 days. What's not to love?
customer_reviews.author: Mary Tatman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn and use.
customer_reviews.text: I love this label maker. It is so easy to use and change out the printer tape. The only problem I had was that sometimes the tape didn't want to stick very well to some things (I was trying to use it on plastic totes), sometimes it would stick other times it would just fall right off. Printer has a couple of different fonts, font sizes, a variety of characters, borders, and you can add a second line. You can even store text that you use over and over again for quick printing.
customer_reviews.author: sephiroth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This product is great. When moving into my new house, there were so many light switches and so many sister light switches that I couldn’t keep them straight. I bought this so I could label all of the switches and it’s very beneficial for myself and for guests.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Roof

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use; but label doesn’t stick to plastic
customer_reviews.text: Initially, test print label, nothing. Called customer service, helped reset label maker and voila ! Unfortunately had to return because label did not stick on plastic bottles. I used the label that came with label maker. I would keep if it stuck to plastic. I thought it would be try test print with authentic label (it might be better than those made “compatible” labels.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Concept was great, the device wasn't. Product died before it printed anything useful.
customer_reviews.author: redman76

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year old and isn't printing well
customer_reviews.text: I had one like this before and it was great. I just bought a new one in January and it already doesn't work. The printing is all faded on the label and it's been like this for a few months. 😢
customer_reviews.author: ProgrammingPlumber

customer_reviews.title: Label maker
customer_reviews.text: Machine works well so far, fairly easy to deal with and print. Quality of print seems good. Still have no idea how I am suppose to peel the label so I can attach it. Have had to use scotch tape because it won't peel.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This label maker is perfect. I love how you can change the font and size. The labels DO stick; you have to tear the paper off of the back and it's split down the middle to make removal easy.
customer_reviews.author: Aisha Waters

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: Takes 4xAA batteries. It went through two sets in 30 minutes of use and that's with an auto shut-off after a minute or so of inactivity. I tested the new batteries before insertion and all were full charge. Even when it displays "Low Batt" the batteries still tested as full charge.
customer_reviews.author: T. Mark Graham

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive product with very CHEAP labeling tape
customer_reviews.text: The handheld unit is easy to use, although if the key pad was laid out like a keyboard the ease of use would be better. Unfortunately, the letters are all alphabetically laid out, so typing is not as natural as a keyboard. My most critical comment is the complete lack of tackiness for the stickers/tape to adhere to anything more than paper. I was using this to label metal panels, but the tape keeps falling off. I’ll end up donating this to the teachers at my sons’ school and finding a better product!
customer_reviews.author: R. P.

customer_reviews.title: Skip This: Get a Brother, Or don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: Hard to use Steep learning curve Clumsy “ABCDE” keyboard instead of “QWERTY” keyboard that we all know. Keys are not finger-friendly. Even older Brother label makers are better than this Dymo model. Save your money: get a Brother instead.
customer_reviews.author: I-DId-Not-Pay-Retail

customer_reviews.title: LABEL AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: I have been having a gay old time organizing and labeling around the home & office. I could not figure out how to get the backing off the labels so I used double stick tape. Afterwards a young employee showed me the trick. Fold the label in half longways folding the print side together. The backing is cut down the middle and now can be easily removed.
customer_reviews.author: Sher Smiles

customer_reviews.title: My heart is broken about this dymo maker letting me down.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was handheld and printed my 1st row of labels fine afterwards it smeared letters and then it eventually twisted. I install new batteries it kept reading low battery and it still failed me . It’s was used for labeling healing salts , butters and healing oils. Amazon has a policy on returns and it’s past return date so I’m very sad😰
customer_reviews.author: Divinity Monique

customer_reviews.title: Don’t trust those magnets on cradle!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the label maker for basic file labeling. The 100h came with the cradle that had magnets on the back. The description even says for mounting on filing cabinets. I placed it up there and the next morning I came to find the label maker on the floor. The adhesive from the back of the magents to the cradle failed and it all fell to the ground. Label maker didn’t work again.
customer_reviews.author: FLRoadman

customer_reviews.title: Everything in my life is labeled now
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice little palm held label maker. And for the price it's worth it. You can adjust adjust font sizes and styles. Cons: the screen is dark and hard to see at times. The keys is on the device alphabetically, and not like a keyboard. With that said the price was great, and if you want a label maker with more/better options then pat more for another one. I like this one, and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dwakka

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: Label maker is easy to use and so far I haven't had any problems with labels sticking to stuff. The first label printed had some weird font on it, but after that it has been great. The only negatives I have with it are the backing on the labels can be hard to peel off sometimes and the keyboard is not a QWERTY so sometimes I find myself hunting for the letters. Overall very happy that I purchased this.
customer_reviews.author: beachbum

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use/Perfect for small labeling jobs
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for small labeling jobs. The extra tape is not too expensive. I would recommend this label maker. A few features I appreciate most include: Spanish symbols (I am a Spanish teacher), easy to use/type and loading new cartridges, coop magnet storage for it so it is easily accessible from under my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki R.

customer_reviews.title: So EZ to use
customer_reviews.text: What a heaven sent item! I really needed something to organize my life(kids too). This Dymo labeler was so easy to set up and to use as well. The choices for borders was a big hit with my 8 and 4 year olds. They love the crocodile the most. The letter sizing is ample and with different fonts it makes this a great tool for organizing almost everything.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D Peck

customer_reviews.title: Easy and simple
customer_reviews.text: I've never used a label maker before and this is easy for me. I don't have any significant needs, just simple things around my office. Can't speak to the battery needs yet like others mentioned. It was annoying that it would turn on, go through settings, and allow me to do everything up until printing...then to say "low battery" and it wouldn't print.
customer_reviews.author: rosewilhelm

customer_reviews.title: Easy to load, navigate, and use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: very easy to load the printing tape, easy to navigate the menu to select font sizes, borders, etc. Has a built-in cutter so you don’t have to snip each label with scissors. Easy to hold and light in hand. Cons: only one font and some of the special symbols look rather primitive/pixely. I also would have preferred a qwerty keyboard layout because I find myself hunting and pecking for the keys since they are in alphabetical order.
customer_reviews.author: Kids.Cats.Crazy.

customer_reviews.title: Won't work straight out of package.
customer_reviews.text: I just removed labeler from packaging. Put brand new batteries in. The screen states "Tape Jam". The machine will NOT work at all. I'm frustrated cause I needed it for a project on Monday. I am not aure how I go about getting it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya0525

customer_reviews.title: Something very strange with this product!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, Day one 12 perfect labels & low battery warning! Day 2, first label 30% print & low battery warning! Change 4 new battery, attempted 12 labels and a total of 10 head cleaning with 30% & less print quality batteries are drained to 024!! Also no cleaning tool with Dymo. And i'm 12 days past return!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, brand new (awful) packaging. The type that you have to pray not to get cut with. Works great, just needs 4 AA batteries. You can choose different font styles, different sizes of font, and can pick which tape to use. The item comes with the plastic tape already inside, so all you have to do it put batteries in. The only negative with this label maker is that it does waste alot of tape on either side of what you printed. So I recommend typing everything you need all at one, with around 4 or 5 spaces in-between the words. This lets there be a minimum of tape waste.
customer_reviews.author: Katerina

customer_reviews.title: So much fun ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my teenage daughter and she has had the BEST time with it. Almost everything and everyone (including pets) has been labeled at some point. It's super easy to use and super fun to start labeling. I was also very happy with the magnetic mounting bracket for the labeler. That makes it super convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Candy Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Nice labeler and comes with 3 tape cartridges
customer_reviews.text: Good buy for the money. Easy snap in cartridges and prints nicely. I had to make a test run on the 1st label and it cut it short and did not feed right away. But after that its great. Has a nice magnetic or screw on holder. It is a bit bulky but it works great. Replacements tape is easy to find and I have no complaints. Very easy to read printing on the labels when finished. No smearing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy labels, easy to work, well made labor maker.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a drone flyer alike to be legal and safe. The Dymo Letra Tag LT100 is super easy to use for getting just the right size lettering for your FAA registration (which is now required visible on outside of drone). Also is super sticky for good hold. You are also able to store labels for repeated use if label should get scraped off or if you by new or additional drones. You can buy different color tape or clear to make label stand out and be easier to read. Anyway, works good for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective item received on the first order.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the DYMO Label Maker with 3 cartridge of labeling tape. The first item was defective, all of the keys did not work. I exchanged it for another and the 2 label maker looked like it was a used unit and the labeling tape that was preloaded into the machine did not print correctly. I'm surprised that they would not have tested the item to make sure it was working correctly since it seemed to be a used unit anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I bought this strictly because I wanted washable fabric labels and found Dymo made them and required this machine. It’s fantastic! Love it so much! It’s easy to use and can’t believe I actually found an affordable machine with extremely affordable cartridges! Haven’t had a problem whatsoever and I’m on cartridge number two!
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: great labeling printer
customer_reviews.text: This comes in handy and very helpful to label shelves, cabinets, e t c. My mom has Alzheimer's so I need to label everything for her.
customer_reviews.author: Virgilio Peralta

customer_reviews.title: Not stick. Recommand to buy other tapes.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to label my baby's stuff. I purchased the inside one together. OMG it didn't stick long not even a day. All of the labels already fell off. But the product itself is not too bad. Large font is not real large, same as medium font size but just stretched widly. But the medium size font is good enough for me. Also price is cheap. So I gave 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bora

customer_reviews.title: 😻no more borrowing my neigbors one😁😁😁
customer_reviews.text: 😎I am supper happy to announce that now I am a proud labels maker owner😎 🤩This is an excellent product to have in any house, I use it like crazy! specially on our remote controls, or to write important phones numbers and stick them around the house 🤩 😄✨We also used them on our basement to label different switches 😄✨ Great to write your internet password under your router, for those guests who come over to be n their phone instead on socializing in real time and space, LOL!😂
customer_reviews.author: MediaBoxEnt

customer_reviews.title: SCAM, SCAM, SCAM!
customer_reviews.text: All positive reviews here are from scammed customers who got this item for free if they post a positive review. Be aware. The device may be is good, but you have to test it by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: alex_is_shopping

customer_reviews.title: Device will NOT turn on.
customer_reviews.text: Device will NOT turn on. I have changed the batteries 3 different times and nothing. I purchased this on 3/1/20 used it twice and it worked wonderfully! However, I tried to turn it on on 5/4/20 and nothing. I changed the batteries 3 different times to new ones and still it would not turn on. In addition, my return window closed on 3/31/20. I find this ridiculous just as I find this device not working ridiculous after only two uses. I want to return or exchange this item. The seller needs to fix this.
customer_reviews.author: A. G. Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed
customer_reviews.text: Loved my previous DYMO label maker. Unfortunately, hubby used it and it doesn’t quite work the same anymore. Bought this as a replacement. Meh... Pro: compact, handheld size Cons: ABC keyboard (for anyone proficient in typing, this is not desirable); labels are quite thin and not glossy like the other model I own; font sizes are extra small, small, medium, large, extra large-no more specific font sizes (8, 12, 16, 20, etc.); no recharging ability, must use batteries Return window is closed, so I’ll either use the old one or wait until after the holidays to shop for a better model. Disappointed after my previous DYMO purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LaKrisha

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not AS good as their older version
customer_reviews.text: Good labelmaker, but I really prefer the old Dymo 100 -- buttons are easier to press, and it seemed to waste a little less tape on both ends. Took off a star because: 1) the enclosed directions were kind of skimpy on details and 2) I don't like that when you clear the screen with the Clear button it clears EVERYTHING, format included. There doesn't seem to be a way to format the unit to default to the size I want to use most often, since the default is Large instead of Medium. But again, maybe the lack of directions is a contributing factor to that frustrating little detail.
customer_reviews.author: Bake Woman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was my first label maker. I will be honest, I dint read the manual and and was able to figure out everyone about it within 4-5 minutes. It's fast and produces clean labels. It's a little bulky,/heavy so I probably wouldn't want to handle it all day. But since I'm not, its perfect for my occasional use.
customer_reviews.author: blossombubble

product_meta.title: DYMO LetraTag 100H Plus Handheld Label Maker for Office or Home
product_meta.description:
Handheld label maker has 2-line printing, 5 font sizes, 7 print styles, 8 box styles. 9-label memory, date stamp, and 3 language options. 13-character LCD screen and graphical display on this label printerlets you see messages, and font and effects on-screen before printing. Prints on LetraTag LT labels available in plastic, metallic, magnetic and iron-on label varieties. Thermal printing needs no ink or toner. Automatic-off saves power. easy-to-navigate, quick-access buttons for swift and easy label making. Uses 4 AA batteries (not included). 1-year warranty.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The new Personal Labelmaker LetraTag features a two times larger LCD display than its predecessor and offers an easy graphical WYSIWYG on screen editor for fonts and style effects
feature_bullets: Choose from 5 font sizes, 7 Print styles and 8 box styles
See font effects on screen before you Print with a graphical display
Take advantage of 9 label memory and 2 line printing
Save power with auto off functionality

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,814 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
